intro: Parasenecio tongchuanensis, commonly known as the Tongchuan parasenecio, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or white, and it produces small, achene-like seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
